intro: Crotalaria jamesii, commonly known as the yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its seeds are often dispersed by wind, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in arid environments. The plant is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
